values: so i was on the subway the other day, and someone had replaced the signs on the door that usually read "do not hold doors." take a look:
this journal is now mostly FRIENDS ONLY.  leave a comment to be added.
great.   now the plasma tv wont show images and my landlord is REALLY mad at me and i wasnt even in the room when it stopped working.  fucking great.

well i am in new york.  i got the road runner cable internet to work, the plasma tv that comes with my furnished apartment is amazing (i'm not joking), and i don't get mtv because i have the most basic cable package time warner offers.  will get upgrade today.

the apt. is a mess because i have no place to store my stuff, really.  welcome to the wonder of nyc closets.  santiago seems stressed out and a bit depressed.  he has peed once where i set up the wee wee pad and once on a random spot on the floor.  i am afraid this move has stressed him out.  he's not used to the sounds of a big city.  he's used to the sounds of allston, which is REALLY quiet compared to nyc.

he barks at everything, and i am afraid bloomberg will come to my door and fine me with those new laws he's trying to pass where your dog cant bark for more than 10 minutes.  oh man.  

other than that i am in good spirits. i will hopefully have brunch with joey and maggie today, kicking off my residency in new york with a bang.  matt leaves later today, which is sad, but we knew this moment would come and he'll be back soon enough so it's ok.  

now i'm going to try and organize my crap, and it wont work, and i will get frustrated and sit down and watch more plasma tv action.  :)

1. What time do you get up?
weekdays, at 7:00 am.  weekends, around 7 am to feed the pup, and then back to bed till 11 or so.  

2. If you could eat lunch with one person, who would it be?
hmm.  joey.  

3. Gold or silver?
white gold. 

4. What was the last film you saw at the cinema?
mean girls!!!  yay film majors!

5. What is your favourite TV show?
law and order svu and america's next top model.  oh! and paradise hotel.  

6. What do you have for breakfast?
coffee.

7. Who would you hate to be stuck in a room with?
tons of people.  on the top of my list is gun's honey.  hahahahaha

8. What/who inspires you?
santiago.  not kidding. 

9. What is your middle name?
beatriz.

10. Beach, City or Country?
city!! new york city, to be exact.  although i do miss the puerto rico beach from which i come.

11. Favourite ice cream?
ben and jerry's one sweet whirled.  amazing!

12. Butter, plain or salted popcorn?
salted and lightly buttered.  

13. Favourite colour?
black 

14. What kind of car do you drive?
i dont here  but in puerto rico i have a beat up 93 volvo

15. Favourite sandwich?
turkey, peperoni, lots of lettuce and muenster cheese on wheat or a bulkie roll

16. What characteristic do you despise?
bragging

17. Favourite flower?
tulips

18. If you could go anywhere in the world on vacation, where would you go?
hmm... i love las vegas if i wanted to stay in the US.  if not, australia or spain or greece

19. What colour is your bathroom?
white

20. Favourite brand of clothing?
dont even get me started.  i <3 fashion, let's leave it at that.  

21. Where would you retire to?
no idea.  i need a job in nyc first!

22. Favourite day of the week?
friday!

23. What did you do for your last birthday?
partied with my roommies.

24. Where were you born?
san juan, puerto rico.

25. Favourite sport?
baseball and hockey


26. What fabric detergent do you use?
tide

27. Coke or Pepsi?
coke 

28. Are you a morning person or a night owl?
neither.  i am a sleeper.  

29. What is your shoe size?
7 1/2 

30. Do you have any pets?
santiago owns me.

wait.  i didnt mean to be so negative.

things i AM looking forward to:

1. being somewhere where it is not fucking 50 degrees every fucking day even though the rest of the country is enjoying 80 degree weather.

2. being someplace that makes me alive.

3. making new friends.

4. starting a new life in a new place.

5. being in a place with NEW YORK YANKEES FANS!!!!!!!!

6. I LOVE NEW YORK.
today i will buy burger king and tons of MAC makeup during my lunch break.  this is me treating myself.
ladyandthetramp yay green! would make a nice eyeshadow.

after a long weekend in new york, i am back, with news.

i got the apartment.  i am moving to new york in june, possibly the 5th or the 12th.

i will be living in a rent controlled apt on the upper west side.  i am very very lucky.

i dont have a job yet but i am optimistic (not really, i'm actually very very scared but whatever).

i am terribly sad to be leaving my friends behind in boston.

but new york awaits, and i need to get excited (i'm not yet.  maybe it hasnt sunk in?).  

matt will move at some point between july and august.  it will be extremely tough to be there without him.

i hope this is the start of something good.

i am heading to new york tonight so i can check out the apt tomorrow and then decide if i will move in june or wait till july or august.  i'm very excited, finally, about my move, because after all, this is what i've wanted for a very long time, and i've worked very hard to get there, saving money and looking for jobs and whatnot and i do think it will all work out.

so yea, things are good.  i have tried to step back and appreciate what i have, and even though i do not have a job lined up, i do have very many positive things in my life, so i am trying to maintain a positive attitude i guess.

i can't wait to become a resident of new york.
i am SO addicted to starbucks java chip fraps it's not even funny.

My coworker Alex and I were trying to come up with creative ways for me to tell my boss that I am quitting for the 2nd time in 7 months (especially now that he's bedridden after an operation for prostate cancer.  yea, i'm a heartless bitch).  Here's what we've come up with so far.

1.  i'm getting married.  leave for lunch one day saying that i'm "meeting someone," then come back an hour later sporting a huge rock and smeared makeup.  make a huge scene and continually stare at my fake ring, whispering, "isn't it beautiful??"

2. i'm pregnant.  call my boss at home late one night and quietly explain that i have some "very private news."  explain that i am pregnant with an out-of-wedlock baby and that my very religious mother will disown me if she finds out, so i am moving to new york, where my imaginary sister knows a doctor who can "take care of it" for $200.  

3.  i have decided to become an actress.  i will move to new york to pursue this "life-long dream" by trying out for herpes and tampax commercials.  

any other suggestions?

even though i totally want a great career and all that, and even though sometimes i'm afraid it won't happen, lately i think the best thing for me this year might be to find a way to pay my bills in new york (i.e., waitress and temp or something like that), and work on my movies, myself, enjoy the city, and apply to grad school, follow a dream.  because sometimes i feel like i'm rushing things when i dont even know exactly what i want to do.  maybe i just need to relax and let things happen when they will happen.  

just because i wont have the best job doesnt mean i wont be succesful.  when i quit my job in november i was miserable, and it was a terrible time for me.  i don't regret what i did, it allowed me to regroup and think about what i need.  

just because everyone follows a path doesnt mean i have to, right?  i'm not saying i dont want a job, obviously i'd love job and benefits security, but maybe that's not my only option.  maybe i can breathe.

current top five favorite things:

1. my morning coffee and muffin from starbucks.

2. fantasizing about how i'm going to decorate my new place in new york.

3. arriving at my house after a long day at work.

4. the weekends.

5. the oc/the swan/the sopranos.  i hope the summer schedule will be good because whatever will i do when my favorite shows are merely reruns??

because my roommates and i are really 16-year-old girls at heart, we went to see Mean Girls last night.  and we loved it.

I AM GOING TO A YANKEE GAME ON MAY 16TH!!!!!! i am very very excited.  VERY EXCITED.  this will be my first yankee game ever.  i will then become a true fan. (not that i'm not already)

i wish today was friday.  i hate weekdays.  HATE THEM.
oh fuck yea, i'm blowing your mind.

congrats to <lj user="jocey"> on her spankin' new job!!

yay!

a real update to come later.

so even though i'm still sarcastic and cynical, i am the happiest i've ever been, i think.  i say this with some hesitation, however, because i always feel as though i'm waiting for the other shoe to drop.  nevertheless i cant deny that for the first time in years i am happy, vibrant, not depressed or anxious, and generally in a good mood.  

this feels really weird to me, as though it must be a trick somehow, as though it can all end in an instant.  so for right now i'm trying to enjoy it and appreciating what i have RIGHT NOW.  

anyway, this doesnt mean that work doesnt suck or anything.  i still hate it here.  i just say it with a smile now. :D

in other news, i think fruit makes me hungry.  today i had an orange and immediately after i ate it i had the most incredible hunger pangs ever.

oh! i almost forgot! i almost got molested today.  not joking.
<lj-cut text="disgusting old man story">
so during my lunch break i was sitting at the Boston Commons (huge park) waiting for a phone call and reading a book, when i notice this 50-ish man sit in the bench across me.  i continue to read for about 15 minutes until i realize he wont stop staring at me.  i look up at him, only to realize that he was MASTURBATING!!! while staring right at me!! while 10 feet away from me!! 

i was totally freaked out so i stood up and walked to the other side of the park and called matt.  he calmed me down and told me to call a cop or something.  i said i'd think about it and we hung up because i had to go back to work.  as soon as i hung up, however, i realize that the old geezer is standing right behind me, finishing himself off!! he was following me!! 

i immediately ran away and found a cop who thannkfully was standing by, and told him my nasty story, gave him the guy's description and went back to work, completely freaked out.  disgusting.  the worst part was i saw his boner.  yea.  </lj-cut>

ok, that's enough for now.  i think i've freaked you all out enough.

I've been going to the same Starbucks every morning since I started to work again, 2 months ago.  I'm always greeted by the same Barista, I'll call him Joe.  Joe always gives me my usual Tall Nonfat Latte and Honey Bran Muffin.  Every single morning, I get the same thing.  

Joe is from Puerto Rico, like me.  Occasionally he hits on me, tells me about his daughter, offers a smile and some banter.  But lately Joe has been giving me the coffee for free, charging me just for the muffin, saving me $2.50.  This adds up to a whopping $7.50 saved every week (yes, i spend a lot on coffee).  

This makes my day, every day.  Thanks, Joe.

post anything that you want, and post it anonymously. anything. a story, a secret, a confession, a fear, a love...anything. just post anything you like be sure to post anonymously and honestly. post twice if you'd like

because i havent exhausted this topic yet (sarcasm), i will now post my current thoughts on my move to new york this summer. 1. the job process is so slow and annoying that it's driving me crazy. i do not want to get to nyc unemployed and broke with a ton of rent to pay. 2. i am nevertheless looking forward to leaving the hellhole that is boston, as i am so sick of being here i can hardly stand it. dont get me wrong, boston is a great city. i've just been here too long. 3. i hate how burnt out everyone my age is. everyone either hates their job, hates their situation to some degree, or wishes they were still in college. do things ever get better for the post-college set? 4. i can't wait to live alone, but i am deathly afraid of being terribly lonely after my move. 5. i hope this is all worth it.

Tonight will be the most nerve-wracking night of my tv-watching career since last October when the Yanks beat the Red Sox in the ALCS. Here is my analysis of what will go down tonight. Kwame: Yes, he's hot. Yes, he's from Harvard. But Omarosa will be the end of sexy, smooth Kwam. She lost Jessica Simpson, for God's sake. You just can't lose the pop star. This will anger the Taj Mahal's general manager, as well as the pop star herself, ending Kwame's chances. Bill: Ahh, Bill. My sweet, panty-dropping Bill. Cigar-smoking, business-owning, drool-inducing Bill. You will win not only my heart and loins, but a quarter of a million dollars and the respect of the Donald. Perhaps there will be a glitch or two in the golf tournament but who cares? You will be victorious. And I will spend a few delicate minutes with my vibrator celebrating for you, with you. :D

taken from a bunch of people on my friends' list. I want everyone who reads this to ask me 3 questions, no more no less. Ask me anything you want. Then I want you to go to your journal, copy and paste this allowing your friends (including myself) to ask you anything.

why hello.

hmm...i think i'll make a list of unrelated things i have to say.

1. a lot of my entries lately have been friends-only so i'm thinking maybe i'll just make the whole journal friends only.  of course, that would mean no one without an lj could read this, which may or may not be a good thing.

2. i have a special message for <lj user="evilbecca">, <lj user="girlsetsfire_">, <lj user="pistashio2"> and <lj user="jocey">.  you guys are the coolest.  random comment, i know.  i just really look forward to your entries.  :)

3. i am obsessed with the lj communities.  top 5 are: <lj comm="b0st0n">, <lj comm="too_much_info">, <lj comm="debate">, <lj comm="phodography"> and <lj comm="bad_sex">.

4.  "The Swan" is amazing.  I hope to work for Fox someday.  I also hope to sell my soul to the devil.

5.  I will now go to lunch aka Power Reading Hour, and finish "The Robber Bride" by Margaret Atwood.  I will also pick up a new book at Barnes and Noble.  This brings me more joy than I can reasonably fathom.

so howard stern is fired from all Clear Channel radio stations.  I listen to howard stern almost every morning, and even though I am almost positive that the Boston station the broadcasts him isn't owned by Clear Channel, I must say I was upset.

so here's my tiny rant of the day:  this FCC thing is getting out of control.  it seems that the religious far right is taking over and enforcing censorship where free speech once ruled.  to me this isn't really just about stern's raunchy humor, or janet's stupid nipple piercing.  it's about people being able to say what you want.  yes, stern goes overboard sometimes, and janet's stunt was a bit much.  but come on, aren't we taking this too far now?  where is freedom of speech?

What turns you off?

i have a few:  complicated, pee, lovely

suckle.  and nipple.

books and movies.  i could talk about this for hours but i won't.

SUPERSTAR!

you did great.

1: Grab the book nearest to you, turn to page 18, find line 4. Write down what it says: "She finishes the set of papers ans goes back to the bedroom to" from The robber bride by Margaret Atwood

2: Stretch your left arm out as far as you can. What do you touch first?: A local tv news schedule

3: What is the last thing you watched on TV?: news, of course.  i was editing something for the Big Dig.  

4: WITHOUT LOOKING, guess what the time is: 5:20 pm

5: Now look at the clock, what is the actual time?: 5:19 pm

6: With the exception of the computer, what can you hear?: the chair's wheels

7: When did you last step outside? what were you doing?: 3 pm.  coming back from lunch.  

9: What are you wearing?: striped shirt, black sweater, jeans

10: Did you dream last night? something that made me grind my teeth and therefore made me wake up with a migraine.  

11: When did you last laugh? last night i think.  i dont laugh much at work.  

12: What is on the walls of the room you are in?: a clock and lots and lots of shelves with video cassettes of news.  

13: Seen anything weird lately?: i watch the news all day.  yes.  

14: What do you think of this quiz?: i'm trying to waste time before i get to go home.  

15: What is the last film you saw?: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

16: If you became a multi-millionaire overnight, what would you buy first?: an apartment in new york. 

17: Tell me something about you that I don't know: i'm psychotic.  

18: If you could change one thing about the world, regardless of guilt or politics, what would you do?: no more war, hunger or poverty

19: Do you like to dance?: yea

20: George Bush: what about him?

21: Imagine your first child is a girl, what do you call her?: no idea

21: Imagine your first child is a boy, what do you call him?: see above

22: Would you ever consider living abroad?: perhaps...although it doesnt seem very likely for right now.

Random thoughts:

1. when you are a confused, secretive and very complicated person, it is not often that you feel understood.  in fact, you often feel as though you are never happy, never enjoying anything.  you feel separated from everyone you know. you are not unhappy, or even hateful, you just dont relate to anyone or anything.

2. there is little i don't obsessively ponder.  and yet there is so much i just dont know.

3. i barely eat during the day, yet i cant stop thinking about food.

4.  i feel closest to the one person in my life who is paid to see me.  i also look forward to seeing him the most.  

5.  this is all quite depressing, yet i dont feel depressed at all.  hmm.   

more later.

here's what i think will happen in America's Next Top Model (aka BEST SHOW EVER) tonight.

I predict that miss shandi aka walgreens with a smile will take home the big bombastic prize, with miss yoanna coming in second.  however, i am having my doubts about yoanna because the judges seem to think she's obese when in fact she's ALMOST as great as Adrienne from the first season, aka THE HOTTEST EVER.

if it were my choice, yoanna would take it all, with shandi coming in second and mercedes third.  i love mercedes' personality but she is simply NOT hautre couture.  

ok, that is all.  :)
my new eyeglasses!!! (in black and gold)

god this day sucks big balls.

it is 55 degrees in this office and i am offically frozen.  the old balls won't close the goddamn windows and unfortunately my coat just isn't enough.  goddamn, i can't wait to get out of here for the second time.

i am addicted to text twist and spider solitaire.  i love getting paid to procrastinate.  i also love to listen to NPR.  

wow, i am a gringa.

last night sex and the city was amazing.  i laughed, i cried, i lusted after Big.

anywho, i'm off to lunch.  more later.
